sentence.Network_en: In the mass production era multinational firms tended to centralize their operations.
sentence.Network_cn: 在大规模生产的时代，跨国公司往往实行集权化经营。

sentence.Network_en: It must decide whether to delegate authority to subsidiaries or centralize.
sentence.Network_cn: 它必须决定是委授权力给公司,还是采取集中办法.

sentence.Network_en: Common system culture does not mean the centralize of global system.
sentence.Network_cn: 普遍制度文明并不意味着全球制度的一元化.

entry.tran: 使权力中央化;对…集权控制
entry.def: To centralize a country, state, or organization means to create a system in which one central group of people gives instructions to regional groups.

example.ex: In the mass production era multinational firms tended to centralize their operations...
example.tran: 在大规模生产的时代，跨国公司往往实行集权化经营。

example.ex: The economy of the times made it difficult to support centralized rule.
example.tran: 当时的经济状况不利于实行集权统治。

sentences.sentence: "The Russian government centralized the distribution of food"

auth_sentence.content: Business always tends to centralize itself.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Business always tends to centralize itself.

means.word_mean: 使处于中央的控制之下,把…集中于中央

sentences.en: The king is trying to centralize all power in his own hands.
sentences.cn: 国王试图把所有的权力都集中在他手中。

sentences.en: The company built a new HQ to centralize their administration.
sentences.cn: 公司建了新总部把管理集中起来。
